BULBASAUR.text: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.

IVYSAUR.text: The bulb on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.

VENUSAUR.text: The flower on its back catches the sun's rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.

CHARMANDER.text: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.

CHARMELEON.text: Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may blow out bluish-white flames.

CHARIZARD.text: When expelling a blast of super hot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

SQUIRTLE.text: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.

WARTORTLE.text: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

BLASTOISE.text: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.

CATERPIE.text: If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.

METAPOD.text: Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.

BUTTERFREE.text: Its wings, covered with poisonous powders, repel water. This allows it to fly in the rain.

WEEDLE.text: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

KAKUNA.text: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

BEEDRILL.text: It has 3 poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

PIDGEY.text: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

PIDGEOTTO.text: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

PIDGEOT.text: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

RATTATA.text: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, it is certain that 40 more live in the area.

RATICATE.text: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

SPEAROW.text: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

FEAROW.text: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

EKANS.text: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

ARBOK.text: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

PIKACHU.text: It keeps its tail raised to monitor its surroundings. If you yank its tail, it will try to bite you.

RAICHU.text: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.

SANDSHREW.text: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.

SANDSLASH.text: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.

NIDORAN].text: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware, its small horns secrete venom.

NIDORINA.text: When resting deep in its burrow, its thorns always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.

NIDOQUEEN.text: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.

NIDORAN[.text: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.

NIDORINO.text: Its horns contain venom. If they are stabbed into an enemy, the impact makes the poison leak out.

NIDOKING.text: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.

CLEFAIRY.text: Adored for their cute looks and playfulness. They are thought to be rare, as they do not appear often.

CLEFABLE.text: They appear to be very protective of their own world. It is a kind of fairy, rarely seen by people.

VULPIX.text: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.

NINETALES.text: According to an enduring legend, 9 noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.

JIGGLYPUFF.text: Uses its alluring eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.

WIGGLYTUFF.text: Its body is full of elasticity. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.

ZUBAT.text: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.

GOLBAT.text: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and suck blood.

ODDISH.text: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.

GLOOM.text: Smells incredibly foul! However, around 1 out of 1,000 people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

VILEPLUME.text: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.

PARAS.text: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

PARASECT.text: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. They appear to do all the thinking.

VENONAT.text: Its large eyes act as radars. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

VENOMOTH.text: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

DIGLETT.text: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.

DUGTRIO.text: A team of triplets that can burrow over 60 MPH. Due to this, some people think it's an earthquake.

MEOWTH.text: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can't stop from picking them up.

PERSIAN.text: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.

PSYDUCK.text: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but it is not known if it intends to do so.

GOLDUCK.text: Its slim and long limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.

MANKEY.text: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

PRIMEAPE.text: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

GROWLITHE.text: A Pokémon with a friendly nature. However, it will bark fiercely at anything invading its territory.

ARCANINE.text: A legendary Pokémon in China. Many people are charmed by its grace and beauty while running.

POLIWAG.text: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.

POLIWHIRL.text: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.

POLIWRATH.text: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake champion swimmers.

ABRA.text: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.

KADABRA.text: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backwards.

ALAKAZAM.text: A Pokémon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns—that's why this Pokémon is smart.

MACHOP.text: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.

MACHOKE.text: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.

MACHAMP.text: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.

BELLSPROUT.text: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny insects with its vines and devours them.

WEEPINBELL.text: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.

VICTREEBEL.text: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is melted in a day, bones and all.

TENTACOOL.text: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.

TENTACRUEL.text: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.

GEODUDE.text: Commonly found near mountain trails, etc. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

GRAVELER.text: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

GOLEM.text: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.

PONYTA.text: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.

RAPIDASH.text: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.

SLOWPOKE.text: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.

SLOWBRO.text: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.

MAGNEMITE.text: It is born with the ability to defy gravity. It floats in air on powerful electromagnetic waves.

MAGNETON.text: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet.

FARFETCH'D.text: Lives where reedy plants grow. They are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.

DODUO.text: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

DODRIO.text: One of Doduo's 2 heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 MPH in prairies.

SEEL.text: Loves freezing cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14F degrees.

DEWGONG.text: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

GRIMER.text: Made of hardened sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.

MUK.text: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration, it lost its sense of smell.

SHELLDER.text: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.

CLOYSTER.text: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.

GASTLY.text: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape as it appears to be made of a gas.

HAUNTER.text: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.

GENGAR.text: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.

ONIX.text: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

DROWZEE.text: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it has eaten in the past.

HYPNO.text: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

KRABBY.text: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.

KINGLER.text: One claw grew massively and as hard as steel. It has 10,000-HP strength. However, it is too heavy.

VOLTORB.text: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

ELECTRODE.text: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

EXEGGCUTE.text: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be 6 heads for it to maintain balance.

EXEGGUTOR.text: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.

CUBONE.text: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.

MAROWAK.text: Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept with its Bone Club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.

HITMONLEE.text: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.

HITMONCHAN.text: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall in the same way as a drill.

LICKITUNG.text: Its tongue spans almost 7 feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.

KOFFING.text: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!

WEEZING.text: It lives and grows by absorbing dust, germs, and poison gases that are contained in toxic waste and garbage.

RHYHORN.text: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won't stop running until it falls asleep.

RHYDON.text: Walks on its hind legs. Shows signs of intelligence. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.

CHANSEY.text: A gentle and kind-hearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.

TANGELA.text: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick, blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.

KANGASKHAN.text: Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won't run from any fight to keep its young protected.

HORSEA.text: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.

SEADRA.text: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.

GOLDEEN.text: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.

SEAKING.text: It is the male's job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.

STARYU.text: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.

STARMIE.text: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in 7 colors.

MR.MIME.text: Always practices its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn't.

SCYTHER.text: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.

JYNX.text: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.

ELECTABUZZ.text: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.

MAGMAR.text: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.

PINSIR.text: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It can't move if it's cold, so it lives in warm places.

TAUROS.text: A rowdy Pokémon with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won't stop until it hits something.

MAGIKARP.text: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.

GYARADOS.text: Brutally vicious and enormously destructive. Known for totally destroying cities in ancient times.

LAPRAS.text: A gentle soul that can read the minds of people. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.

DITTO.text: When it spots an enemy, its body transforms into an almost perfect copy of its opponent.

EEVEE.text: Its genetic code is unstable, so it could evolve in a variety of ways. There are only a few alive.

VAPOREON.text: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It will melt away and become invisible in water.

JOLTEON.text: A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.

FLAREON.text: It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales, then blows out fire that is over 3,000F degrees.

PORYGON.text: The only Pokémon people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.

OMANYTE.text: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swims by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

OMASTAR.text: Sharp beaks ring its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.

KABUTO.text: A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It uses the eyes on its back while hiding on the sea floor.

KABUTOPS.text: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.

AERODACTYL.text: A savage Pokémon that died out in ancient times. It was resurrected using DNA taken from amber.

SNORLAX.text: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.

ARTICUNO.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.

ZAPDOS.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

MOLTRES.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its blazing wings, even the night sky will turn red.

DRATINI.text: The existence of this mythical Pokémon was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.

DRAGONAIR.text: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.

DRAGONITE.text: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, it is only a rumor.

MEWTWO.text: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew's. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

MEW.text: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon's short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
